meanings.definition: Not holding or catching the attention; uninteresting.
meanings.sent1: The lecture was disinteresting, and many students struggled to stay awake.
meanings.sent2: The movie was so disinteresting that I fell asleep halfway through.
meanings.sent3: The disinteresting book made for a great cure for insomnia.
meanings.sent4: Her disinteresting presentation was like watching paint dry.
meanings.sent5: The disinteresting landscape failed to captivate any onlookers.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to lose interest or enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: The monotonous speech disinterested the audience within minutes.
meanings.sent2: Constant interruptions can disinterest even the most engaged listeners.
meanings.sent3: His attempts to disinterest her in the topic only made her more curious.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive tasks slowly disinterested the once enthusiastic employee.
meanings.sent5: The lack of variety in the menu disinterested the regular customers.
